title: Where is the oldest bristlecone pine tree? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: Where is the oldest bristlecone pine tree? Pinus longaeva (aka Great Basin bristlecone pine, intermountain bristlecone pine, or western bristlecone pine) are found in the higher mountains of the USA states of California, Nevada, and Utah. Unsurprisingly the location of the measured two oldest specimens is closely held that they may continue to prosper (if that’s the right word). The oldest specimen is just over 5,000 years old! I’ve seen a few in situ: they are quite impressive as they appear to be on their last legs and barely hanging on to life. Here’s a Wikipedia link Pinus longaeva - Wikipedia

I think a lot of these softball guestions being asked on Quora are to make money from Quora. If you ask a question, you get paid by Quora. If I answer a question, I get nothing from Quora. Why should I use my knowledge to enrich the one asking the question?
